title.narrative: Integrated humanitarian response to the Provision of access to a quality education and Children Protection for IDPs children living in AlAlam camps in Salahaldin

description.narrative:
The project (Integrated humanitarian response to the Provision of access to a quality education and Children Protection for IDPs children living in AlAlam camps in Salahaldin) that Sorouh will implement aims at the provision of immediate access to inclusive safe and protected learning environment and provides better education opportunities for IDPs children living in AlAlam camps 1,2,3 in Salahaldin Governorate, Iraq. The project will continued to meet the educational needs for the newly coming IDP children from Hawija, Sharqat and Mosul . The two TLS Schools which had opened in AlAlam camps 1 , 2 with three shifts. 2220 of school aged IDP children in AlAlam camps are attending formal school since mid Feb , 2017 with 60 teachers up to 30/5/2017 DoE who have lack of the teachers and the resource faces hard situation to continue the project while 2220 Children and will not be able to continue their formal education and catch up classes as the MoE put timetable for the final examination of 2017 ( 2017/6/4 for the intermediate schools and 2017/7/2 for the secondary schools) Also the newly coming IDPs from Hawija, Sharqat ,and Mosul who will settled in AlAlam 3 will not find educational opportunities to meet their needs. Target groups are 3000 (being 978 boys- primary School for boys , 888 primary School for girls and 347 Secondary School for boys amp girls) with 60 teacher , 40 PTA and 18 remedial education teachers. Also, 660 newly IDPs will be enrolled in the three schools. The proposed age group of 6-19 years who have been displaced from Hawija , Sharqat ,and Mosul. The project will establish 10 prefabs in the two TLS overcrowded schools which have (3rd shift with more than 100 students for each classrooms ) to provide more space to the newly coming IDPs from Hawija . Some of prefabs will be used as CFSs and Remedial Education. 60 teachers will continue their classes to finish the text books at least for the final intermediate and secondary students. Also, it is expected that many students may fail in the final exams due to the short period of classes and need catch up classes during the summer holiday.
The project will provide Mine Risk Education sessions for the students about the risks of landmines and other explosive Ordnances in the camps with child health services, hygiene messages to children. The project will provide the beneficiaries with summer needs (fans , air coolers , cold water tools. Also , the project will continue the psychosocial support (PSS), child health services, hygiene messages to children and child Resilience (CR) and CFSs area will be establish for all schools Number of project direct beneficiaries reaches 3000 people while indirect beneficiaries may reached 21.000. The project shall last for 6 months starting from 1st June 2017 and ending in 31 Dec 2017.
